title: Level 4 - 고급 문법 심화와 격식 있는 표현 (REVISED)
description: 미래완료, 도치구문, 사역동사 등 고급 문법과 비즈니스/학술 상황의 격식 있는 표현 마스터

revision_info.reason: 상황별 영어 → 체계적 문법 중심으로 복원
revision_info.changes: 원본 문법 진행 로드맵 기반으로 REVISED 스키마 적용, 29 stages로 확장

stages.title: 미래완료
stages.pattern: will have + p.p. (미래의 한 시점까지 완료될 동작)

slots.en: By next year, I will have graduated
By then, we will have finished the project
I will have arrived home by 6 o'clock
We will have moved by next month

slots.kr: 그가 올 때쯤이면 준비를 마쳤을 거야
slots.en: I will have prepared everything by the time he comes

stages.title: 미래완료진행
stages.pattern: will have been + ing (미래의 한 시점까지 계속 진행)

slots.kr: 다음 달이면 여기서 일한 지 5년이 돼
slots.en: Next month, I will have been working here for 5 years

slots.kr: 내년이면 영어를 배운 지 10년이 될 거야
slots.en: Next year, I will have been learning English for 10 years

slots.kr: 그때면 기다린 지 두 시간이 될 거야
slots.en: By then, we will have been waiting for two hours
In June, I will have been living here for 3 years

slots.kr: 올해 말이면 공부한 지 1년이 될 거야
slots.en: By the end of this year, I will have been studying for a year

stages.title: 현재완료 vs 과거완료
stages.pattern: 현재완료(현재와 연결) vs 과거완료(과거 시점과 연결)

slots.en: I have lost my key so I can't get in now
I had lost my key so I couldn't get in then
I have finished my homework so I'm free now

slots.kr: 숙제를 끝내서 그때 놀 수 있었어
slots.en: I had finished my homework so I could play then
I have seen the movie so I know the story

stages.title: 혼합 가정법
stages.pattern: If + 과거완료, would + 동사원형 (과거 조건, 현재 결과)

slots.en: If I had studied then, I would be a doctor now

slots.kr: 어릴 때 운동했다면 지금 더 건강할 텐데
slots.en: If I had exercised when young, I would be healthier now

slots.kr: 그가 왔다면 지금 여기 있을 텐데
slots.en: If he had come, he would be here now
If I had saved money, I would be rich now

slots.kr: 그때 결정했다면 지금 다른 상황일 텐데
slots.en: If we had decided then, things would be different now

stages.title: 가정법 과거완료
stages.pattern: If + 과거완료, would have + p.p. (과거의 가정)

slots.en: If I had gotten up early, I wouldn't have been late

slots.kr: 비가 오지 않았다면 소풍을 갔을 텐데
slots.en: If it hadn't rained, we would have gone on a picnic
If he had helped, we would have succeeded
If I had known the way, I wouldn't have gotten lost
If I had prepared, I would have done well on the test

stages.title: 수동태 응용
stages.pattern: 동명사 수동형, 완료형 수동태

slots.en: I don't like being told what to do
He has been given a second chance
The project should have been completed by now
I enjoy being praised
The problem has already been solved

stages.title: 사역동사
stages.pattern: have/make/let/get + 목적어 + 동사원형/과거분사

slots.en: I had my assistant print the report
The movie made me cry
My mom let me go out
I got my car fixed
I want to make him laugh

stages.title: 지각동사
stages.pattern: see/hear/watch/feel + 목적어 + 동사원형/ing

slots.en: I saw him leave
I hear children playing
I watched her dancing
I felt my heart beat
I heard someone knock

stages.title: 도치 구문
stages.pattern: 부정어/제한어구로 시작하는 도치

slots.en: Not only did we lose money, but we also lost time
Never have I seen such a view
Hardly had I arrived when the show started
Only then did I realize the truth
Seldom have I been happier

stages.title: 병렬 구조와 등위접속사
stages.pattern: and/or/but으로 연결하는 병렬 구조

slots.en: I like swimming and running
He is smart but also very kind

slots.kr: 일찍 일어나거나 늦게 자거나 해야 해
slots.en: You need to either get up early or sleep late
I have to both study and work
Whether I succeed or fail, I'll do my best

stages.title: 명사절 축약
stages.pattern: that절을 to부정사로 축약

slots.en: I have a report to finish
I have nowhere to go
I have something to say
I have a lot of work to do
I have someone to meet

stages.title: 형용사절 축약
stages.pattern: 관계절을 분사구문으로 축약

slots.en: The man standing on the corner
The book bought yesterday
Children laughing
The woman sitting by the window
The broken window

stages.title: 부사절 축약
stages.pattern: 시간/조건/양보절을 분사구문으로 축약

slots.en: After finishing dinner, I watched TV
While walking, I listened to music
Tired, he kept working
Reading a newspaper, I drink coffee
Leaving early, we weren't late

stages.title: 강한 확신과 강조 표현
stages.pattern: There's no doubt that / I can assure you that

slots.kr: 그가 성공할 거라는 건 의심의 여지가 없어
slots.en: There's no doubt that he will succeed

slots.kr: 확신할 수 있는 건 그가 정직하다는 거야
slots.en: I can assure you that he is honest
I can say with certainty that this is the best choice
I am absolutely certain
Without a doubt, that's correct

stages.title: 완곡한 표현
stages.pattern: I tend to think / It seems to me that

slots.en: I tend to think that might be rather difficult

slots.kr: 내 생각에는 더 나은 방법이 있을 것 같아
slots.en: It seems to me that there might be a better way
I wonder if we might reconsider
Perhaps we need a different approach
I'm afraid I find it hard to agree

stages.title: 부분 동의와 반박
stages.pattern: I agree up to a point, but / Don't get me wrong, but

slots.en: I agree up to a point, but not entirely

slots.kr: 오해하지 말고 들어, 하지만 문제가 있어
slots.en: Don't get me wrong, but there's a problem
That's partially correct, but not overall
It's a good idea, but not practical
In principle I agree, but practically it's difficult

stages.title: 논리적 전환
stages.pattern: Having said that / Nonetheless / On the contrary

slots.en: Having said that, there are still problems
Nonetheless, we must continue

slots.kr: 그와는 반대로 더 나은 결과가 나왔어
slots.en: On the contrary, we got better results
On the other hand
Nevertheless, we succeeded

stages.title: 결과 및 영향 설명
stages.pattern: This led to / As a result / Consequently

slots.en: This led to significant changes
As a result, we had to change our plans
Consequently, we need a new approach
This resulted in increased sales
This caused delays

stages.title: It 구문 활용
stages.pattern: It's worth ~ing / It's no use ~ing / It's essential that

slots.en: It's worth visiting the museum
It's no use arguing with him
It's essential that we prepare
It's worth trying
It's no use worrying

stages.title: 가능성 표현 확장
stages.pattern: There's a chance that / The likelihood is that

slots.en: There's a chance that it will rain
The likelihood is that we will succeed
There's a possibility that I'll be late
There's a chance the plan might change
The likelihood is that problems will arise

stages.title: 추측 표현 심화
stages.pattern: must have p.p. / can't have p.p. / could have p.p.

slots.kr: 그가 우리 만남을 잊은 게 틀림없어
slots.en: He must have forgotten our meeting

slots.kr: 그녀가 그렇게 빨리 끝냈을 리 없어
slots.en: She can't have finished it so soon
He could have left already
I might have been wrong
They can't have heard us

stages.title: 과거 사실에 대한 가정·후회
stages.pattern: should have p.p. / would have p.p. / needn't have p.p.

slots.en: I should have left earlier
If he had helped, we would have succeeded
You needn't have worried so much
I should have told you beforehand
I would have done it differently

stages.title: 결정과 판단
stages.pattern: I'm inclined to / I'm tempted to / I'm convinced that

slots.en: I'm inclined to agree
I'm tempted to give up
I'm convinced that's correct
I'm inclined to think we need change
I'm tempted to try again

stages.title: 설득 표현
stages.pattern: You might want to / I strongly suggest that

slots.kr: 이걸 확인해보는 게 좋을 것 같아
slots.en: You might want to check this out
I strongly suggest that we move on to the next topic
You might want to reconsider
I recommend seeking expert advice
I strongly believe we should change the plan

stages.title: 토론 및 반론
stages.pattern: From my perspective / That's not necessarily true because

slots.kr: 내 관점에서는 다른 문제가 더 중요해
slots.en: From my perspective, other issues are more important

slots.kr: 그게 반드시 맞는 건 아니야 왜냐하면
slots.en: That's not necessarily true because
The main reason is the cost
On the other hand, there are other options
There's a flaw in that logic

stages.title: 조건부 제안
stages.pattern: Provided that / As long as / On condition that

slots.en: Provided that all conditions are met, I agree
As long as the budget is sufficient, we can proceed
On condition that quality is guaranteed
Provided that time allows
As long as everyone agrees

stages.title: 시간 관계 표현
stages.pattern: By the time / No sooner than / Whenever

slots.en: By the time he arrives, it will be dark
No sooner had we left than it started raining
Whenever you need help, just call me
As soon as we're ready, we'll start
Once work is finished, let's meet

stages.title: 장단점 비교
stages.pattern: The advantage of ~ is, but the downside is

slots.en: The advantage of working from home is flexibility, but the downside is communication

slots.kr: 이 계획의 장점은 비용 절약이지만 위험도 있어
slots.en: The benefit of this plan is cost savings, but there are risks

slots.kr: 온라인 쇼핑은 편리하지만 직접 볼 수 없어
slots.en: Online shopping is convenient, but you can't see items directly

slots.kr: 빠르긴 하지만 정확하지 않을 수 있어
slots.en: It's fast, but it might not be accurate
It's effective, but expensive

stages.title: 종합 커뮤니케이션
stages.pattern: In summary / To conclude / All things considered

slots.en: In summary, the plan was successful
To conclude, we need changes

slots.kr: 모든 걸 고려했을 때 좋은 결정이야
slots.en: All things considered, it's a good decision
Overall, I'm satisfied
Ultimately, we reached an agreement
